{{This date in recent years}}
{{Day}}  Typically the [[March equinox]] falls on this date, marking the vernal point in the [[Northern Hemisphere]] and the autumnal point in the [[Southern Hemisphere]], when both day and night are of equal length.

==Events==
* [[235]] &ndash; [[Maximinus Thrax]] is proclaimed emperor. He is the first foreigner to hold the Roman [[throne]].
* [[673]] &ndash; Emperor [[Emperor Tenmu|Tenmu]] of [[Japan]] assumes the [[Chrysanthemum throne]] at the [[Asuka, Yamato#Imperial Palaces|Palace of Kiyomihara]] in [[Asuka, Yamato|Asuka]].
*[[1206]] &ndash; [[Patriarch Michael IV of Constantinople|Michael IV Autoreianos]] is appointed [[Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople]].
*[[1600]] &ndash; The [[Linköping Bloodbath]] takes place on [[Maundy Thursday]] in [[Linköping]], [[Sweden]].
*[[1602]] &ndash; The [[Dutch East India Company]] is established.
*[[1616]] &ndash; [[Walter Raleigh|Sir Walter Raleigh]] is freed from the [[Tower of London]] after 13 years of imprisonment.
*[[1760]] &ndash; The "[[List of historic fires|Great Fire]]" of [[Boston, Massachusetts]], destroys 349 buildings.
*[[1815]] &ndash; After escaping from [[Elba]], [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]] enters [[Paris]] with a regular army of 140,000 and a volunteer force of around 200,000, beginning his "[[Hundred Days]]" rule.
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Revolutions of 1848 in the German states]]: [[Monarch|King]] [[Ludwig I of Bavaria]] abdicates.
*[[1852]] &ndash; [[Harriet Beecher Stowe]]'s ''[[Uncle Tom's Cabin]]'' is published.
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party of the United States]] is organized in [[Ripon, Wisconsin]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; An [[earthquake]] completely destroys [[Mendoza, Argentina]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; The [[Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property]] is signed.
*[[1888]]  &ndash; The premiere of the very first [[Romen Theatre#Forerunners of Romen Theatre|Romani language operetta]] is staged in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Sung Chiao-jen]], a founder of the [[Kuomintang|Chinese Nationalist Party]], is wounded in an assassination attempt and dies 2 days later.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Albert Einstein]] publishes his [[general relativity|general theory of relativity]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The {{USS|Langley|CV-1}} is commissioned as the first [[United States Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; The [[Arts Club of Chicago]] hosts the opening of [[Pablo Picasso]]'s first United States showing, entitled ''Original Drawings by Pablo Picasso'', becoming an early proponent of [[modern art]] in the United States.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Zangara]] is [[execution (legal)|executed]] in [[Florida]]'s [[electric chair]] for fatally shooting [[Anton Cermak]] in an assassination attempt against [[President of the United States|President]]-Elect [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]].
*  1933   &ndash; [[Reichsführer-SS]] [[Heinrich Himmler]] ordered the creation of [[Dachau Concentration Camp]] as [[Chief of Police]] of [[Munich]] and appointed [[Theodor Eicke]] as the camp commandant.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[General]] [[Douglas MacArthur]], at [[Terowie]], [[South Australia]], makes his famous speech regarding the [[Battle of the Philippines (1942)|fall of the Philippines]], in which he says: "I came out of [[Bataan]] and I shall return".
*[[1948]] &ndash; With a [[American Federation of Musicians|Musicians Union]] ban lifted, the first telecasts of classical music in the [[United States]], under [[Eugene Ormandy]] and [[Arturo Toscanini]], are given on [[CBS]] and [[NBC]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Fujiyoshida]], a [[city]] located in [[Yamanashi Prefecture]], Japan, in the center of the Japanese main island of [[Honshū]] is founded.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] ratifies a [[peace treaty]] with Japan.
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Tunisia]] gains independence from [[France]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[wiktionary:Precursor|precursor]] of the [[European Space Agency]], [[ESRO]] ([[European Space Research Organization]]) is established per an agreement signed on [[June 14]], [[1962]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: A [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] car bomb kills seven and injures 148 in [[Belfast]], [[Northern Ireland]]. It was the first of many car bomb attacks by the group.
*[[1974]] &ndash; Ian Ball attempts, but fails, to kidnap [[Her Royal Highness]] [[Anne, Princess Royal|Princess Anne]] and her husband [[Captain Mark Phillips]] in [[The Mall (London)|The Mall]], outside [[Buckingham Palace]], [[London]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[Radio Caroline]] ship, Mi Amigo founders in a gale off the [[England|English]] coast.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Libby Riddles]] becomes the first woman to win the 1,135-mile [[Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race]].
*  1985   &ndash; Canadian [[paraplegic]] athlete and [[humanitarian]] [[Rick Hansen]] begins his [[circumnavigation]] of the globe in a wheelchair in the name of [[spinal cord]] injury medical research.
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[Food and Drug Administration]] approves the anti-[[AIDS]] drug, [[Zidovudine|AZT]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Eritrean War of Independence]]: Having defeated the Nadew Command, the [[Eritrean People's Liberation Front]] enters the town of [[Afabet]], victoriously concluding the [[Battle of Afabet]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand Marcos]]'s widow, [[Imelda Marcos]], goes on trial for [[bribery]], [[embezzlement]], and [[racketeering]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: A Provisional IRA bomb [[Warrington bomb attacks|kills two children]] in [[Warrington]], England. It leads to mass protests in both Britain and Ireland.
*[[1995]] &ndash; A [[sarin gas attack on the Tokyo subway]] kills 13 and wounds 1,300 persons.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Legoland California]], the first [[Legoland]] outside of [[Europe]], opens in [[Carlsbad, California]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Jamil Abdullah Al-Amin]], a former [[Black Panther Party|Black Panther]] once known as [[H. Rap Brown]], is captured after murdering [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] sheriff's deputy Ricky Kinchen and critically wounding Deputy Aldranon English.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[2003 invasion of Iraq]]: In the early hours of the morning, the [[United States]] and three other countries (the UK, Australia and Poland) begin military operations in [[Iraq]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; Over 150 [[Chadian military|Chadian soldiers]] are killed in eastern [[Chad]] by members of the rebel [[United Front for Democratic Change|UFDC]]. The rebel movement sought to overthrow [[Heads of state of Chad|Chadian president]] [[Idriss Deby]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; At least 52 people are killed and more than 250 injured in a [[20 March 2012 Iraq attacks|wave of terror attacks]] across 10 cities in [[Iraq]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; Four suspected [[Taliban]] members [[2014 Kabul Serena Hotel attack|attack]] the luxurious [[Kabul Serena Hotel]], killing at least 9 people.
